column4: Lol, :) Anything to say to me, friend?
Actually, for programming, the best is Geany, which is an editor
I mean, editor + ide. Also, for general purposes, Gedit is nice.
Jedit is nice, but for being made in Java, it is a bit slow. (As Java is interpreted_
ye thats why im kinda afraid of it...
No problem. If you take my view, use Geany for Programming + Editing, and Gedit for general editing. Also, Kate is a bit slow in GNOME, for Klibs are to be loaded.
i need smth with a good syntax autodetection
notepad++ is extremely good in that
Ah, Geany is the good replacement for Notepad++, :D And it not only detects Syntaxes, but even compiles, builds and executes programmes, :)
im gonna try it out then;)
Sure, :) Just use this in terminal: sudo apt-get install geany (It is small, and great)
i know how to install stuff;)
Oh, sorry, :( Just thought of providing the command, nevermind friend, :)
man it looks great...n its fast...
